{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3500565,"name":"Diego dos Santos Amaral ","username":"Feldix","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/4af34b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-03T13:07:36.694Z","cooked":"

Hello, our team has started to migrate the programming language from labview to python, due to the students seeing it in their classes and being more used to it, so we are still new to it. We’ve already managed to read the position of the encoder and command a motor to go in the direction we tell it to. The problem is that we want to use PID for our tower system, but since it’s more work to change one of the PID parameters in the program and deploy it, we want the shuffleboard to receive a value and send this change to the variable directly to the code. But no matter how much we change the values in the shuffleboard, nothing happens, only the default values remain.

import phoenix5
from wpilib import TimedRobot, Joystick, SmartDashboard
from phoenix5 import WPI_TalonSRX, ControlMode, NeutralMode

class TowerBot(TimedRobot):
    def robotInit(self):
        self.tower_motor = WPI_TalonSRX(2)  # Motor da torre
        self.controller = Joystick(0)  # Controle no slot 0

        SmartDashboard.putNumber("P Gain", 1.0)
        SmartDashboard.putNumber("I Gain", 0.002)
        SmartDashboard.putNumber("D Gain", 10.0)
        SmartDashboard.putNumber("F Gain", 0.07)

        self.max_height = 500000  
        self.min_height = -500000  

    def teleopPeriodic(self):
        if self.controller.getRawButton(1):  # Botão 1 -> Ir para a altura máxima
            self.tower_motor.set(ControlMode.Position, self.max_height)
        elif self.controller.getRawButton(2):  # Botão 2 -> Ir para a altura mínima
            self.tower_motor.set(ControlMode.Position, self.min_height)
        elif self.controller.getRawButton(3):
        # Resetar o encoder para começar na posição zero
            self.tower_motor.setSelectedSensorPosition(0, 0, 10)

        p_gain = SmartDashboard.getNumber("P Gain", 1.0)
        i_gain = SmartDashboard.getNumber("I Gain", 0.002)
        d_gain = SmartDashboard.getNumber("D Gain", 10.0)
        f_gain = SmartDashboard.getNumber("F Gain", 0.07)
        
        # **Atualizar os valores do PID no Talon SRX**
        self.tower_motor.config_kP(0, p_gain, 10)
        self.tower_motor.config_kI(0, i_gain, 10)
        self.tower_motor.config_kD(0, d_gain, 10)
        self.tower_motor.config_kF(0, f_gain, 10)


        # **Ler posição do encoder**
        encoder_position = self.tower_motor.getSelectedSensorPosition(0)

        # **Enviar valor do encoder para a Dashboard**
        SmartDashboard.putNumber("Encoder Position (ticks)", encoder_position)

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-02-03T13:38:45.341Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":44,"readers_count":43,"score":18.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":484897,"topic_slug":"shuffleboard-input","display_username":"Diego dos Santos Amaral ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":38843,"username":"ksquare","name":null,"avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ksquare/{size}/121038_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58286,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/shuffleboard-input/484897/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3500589,"name":"Davo","username":"auscompgeek","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/auscompgeek/{size}/9867_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-03T13:53:33.918Z","cooked":"

A side note: you really don’t want to reconfigure the PID gains over CAN on every control loop when they haven’t changed — the code you have sends the CAN message to reconfigure and waits for acknowledgement from the motor controller, which is quite slow.

As others have suggested, reconfiguring in Phoenix Tuner will be the easiest way to achieve what you want, but if you’d like to use the dashboard like this, I’d suggest using the Spark Max velocity PID example as inspiration. robotpy-rev/examples/velocity-pid-control/robot.py at main · robotpy/robotpy-rev · GitHub

Yes! One of many you can read about here: Dashboards — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

Glass and Elastic are both newer with features not supported in Shuffleboard or SmartDashboard.

Yes, I should have been as helpful as @kingc95 and provided a link. I suggest it because it is simple and reliable for tuning tasks like you are trying to do…. More of a programmer/tuning tool than an operator dashboard. You shouldn’t have to change any code to see it and use it. You should be able to “browse” the network tables and find your PID. To send the updated value hit tab or click on another widget. The enter key can have some unintended consequences…. (Disables the robot if you are using the same laptop with the drivers station…. Which may cause potential energy to rapidly translate to kinetic energy and is normally quickly followed by the build team providing commentary.)

We have had the same problem and this was fixed by adding the widgets to Shuffleboard as Shuffleboard.getTab("Foo").addNumber("P", () -> this.p).getEntry(); and reading the GenericEntry in your code with entry.getDouble() although this code will only work with Elastic (I haven’t tried with Glass) and not ShuffleBoard which will not allow you to edit these values for some reason.
